profiles.migrations¶

profiles.migrations.0001_initialize_and_transfer_data module¶

class profiles.migrations.0001_initialize_and_transfer_data.Migration(name, app_label)¶

Bases: Migration

This migration creates the Profile model in the ‘profiles’ app, then runs a data transfer operation to move existing data from the old models in ‘oc_lettings_site’ to the newly created models.

Attributes:

initial (bool): Indicates whether this is an initial migration. dependencies (list): Specifies the migration dependencies.

This migration depends on the initial migration of the ‘lettings’ app.

operations (list): A list of operations to be performed in this migration.

This includes creating the new models and running the transfer_data function to move the data.

dependencies = [('lettings', '0001_initialize_and_transfer_data')]¶
initial = True¶
operations = [<CreateModel  name='Profile', fields=[('id', <django.db.models.fields.AutoField>), ('favorite_city', <django.db.models.fields.CharField>), ('user', <django.db.models.fields.related.OneToOneField>)]>, <RunPython <function transfer_data>>]¶
profiles.migrations.0001_initialize_and_transfer_data.transfer_data(apps, schema_editor) → None¶

This function is intended to be used in a Django migration to transfer Profile data from the old models in the oc_lettings_site app to the new models in the Profile app.

Args:

apps (Apps): An instance that gives access to the historical versions of models. schema_editor (SchemaEditor): The database schema editor responsible

for applying the migration.

Returns:

None
